snippet: Interviews, documents and legal records show that when the most senior Rutgers officials learned details about Mike Rice’s behavior toward players, they ignored them or issued light penalties.
abstract: Interviews, documents and legal records show that when senior-most Rutgers officials learned details about men's basketball coach Mike Rice's behavior toward players, they ignored them or issued light penalties; reveal culture in which university was far more concerned with protecting itself from legal action than with protecting its students from abusive coach.

byline.contributor: Nate Schweber and Marc Santora contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Interviews, documents and legal records show that when the most senior Rutgers officials learned details about Mike Rice’s behavior toward players, they ignored them or issued light penalties.
